result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew J. Erbrecht was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Carry Concealed Weapon [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office. 

Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent.

AODA and follow through;

DNA sample
Maintain fulltime work/school or combination of the two, and if not so fully engaged, complete 9 hours CS per week.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew J. Erbrecht

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: Amanda. 
Case called at 3:25 pm. 
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig.  Defendant appears, pro se.

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.

State moves to: 
DRI Ct.2(Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin). 

State's uncharged case 22MA2523 will also be read in. 

COURT GRANTS ABOVE.

PLEA to:
Ct.1(Possession of THC/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST.
Ct.3(Carry Concealed Weapon/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding; 
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, defendant is competent to represent self, a factual basis & defendant guilty;

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 1 year probation; CONDITIONS: Assessments/Treatment/Counseling deemed appropriate by agent. Maintain full time work/school or combination of the two, and if not so fully engaged, complete 9 hours CS per week. Maintain absolute sobriety. AODA and follow through.  No possession of any firearms.  Pay CC/DNA surcharge and provide sample. 

Court grants 4 days credit. 

Adj: 3:34 pm.

Pre-trial conference on July 14, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Final pre-trial on July 28, 2022 at 03:20 pm.
Jury status hearing on September 6, 2022 at 03:20 pm.
Jury Trial on September 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.   Defendant shall not possess any dangerous weapons during the pendency of this action.

Clerk: Heather. 
Case called: 2:28 p.m.
State appears by ADA Kerri Puig.  Defendant appears in person, pro se.

Date and time set for initial appearance. VRCW.  
Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel. 
PLEA: NOT GUILTY on CMs

COURT ORDERS: $500.00 signature bond. 

CONDITIONS: 
- Absolute sobriety from and no possession of controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.  
- No possession or use of firearms.

DATES:
PTC W/JA: 7/14/22 @ 2:00 p.m. 
FPT/TP: 7/28/22 @ 3:20 p.m. 
JSH: 9/6/22 @ 3:20 p.m. 
JT: 9/20/22 @ 9:00 a.m. 
Branch 3.

Adjourned: 2:32 p.m.
